Posts.Content: May 29, 2012 06:05PM longislandmom wrote: Hi, Gail.  I had mammogram on March 8, sterotactic biopsy on March 12, and got the phone call on March 13th.  The first few weeks are the worst. I felt like my head was literally exploding from information overload.  and talking to people did NOT make it easier.  In fact, one thing i found useful was to send out an email to friends and loved ones assuring them that i loved them, but letting them know that i couldn't really talk to them re: BC right then.  Another possibility if you have a lot of people inquiring is to set up a caringbridge.org website.  i did that to reduce the burden on me and my husband re: communicating re: my treatment.   I promise that Once you have a diagnosis and  a game plan it becomes somewhat easier to move forward.  I agree with Suebak...this website has been incredibly helpful and supportive.  you are not alone.  I'll keep you in my thoughts and prayers hoping for the best possible news re: staging.
Posts.Title: Recently Diagnosed floridatworeds rita65

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 06:02AM longislandmom wrote: Also..he used alloderm in reconstruction.
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2012 07:57PM longislandmom wrote: @ pixie net..And floridamom ....surgery took between 3-4 hours...not quite sure exactly how long vs. recovery and prep. Sentinal node mapping shots are nothing....do not even give it a second thought...little pinch is all. I have not gotten any pathology back yet...but I a, thinking and praying the fact they only took SNB (2 in BC side and 1 in prophy side) is a good sign. I have not been on painkillers since yesterday. Just tylenoland a bit of Valium at night. I am lucky and the pain has never been too bad...but that probably varies from person to person. I was on IV pain for a day and vicodan for 3 days. I am up and around...but limited. I have walked around the block, gone to get my hair washed and blown, and walk around the halls. But I am still very very tired.. I am tight and sore, but nothing is unbearable. I am basically lounging around and napping between visitors. I'm planning on giving myself two weeks before I really try to do much...need to get these drains out first! I know it's easier to say this than to believe it...but the anxiety of surgery truly is the worst part. You can get through this!!!! Fel free to ask any questions. Best of luck.
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 06:02AM longislandmom wrote: @ pixienel, yes. I had TE placed during surgery. My PS filled me pretty aggressively, so I actually have small mounds now. Prob an A cup ( I was DDD) before. They saved extra skin for expansion so they are kind of lumpy and irregular looking.and my incisions are probably larger than most because of the size of my breasts....but the appearance doesn't bother me. I know I need to be patient. The TE makes your chest feel tight...like u r wearing a bra inside. Not pleasant...but ok. Honestly, I am more focused and concerned re: good path report next week. Maybe after that I'll worry about boob look!!!
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2012 04:59PM longislandmom wrote: Hi, may ladies. I am just dropping in to tell you that I had a BMX this past Monday and am doing OK. You can do this!!! It's not as bad as you imagine it wil be. Myn Ifesaver was a taped guided meditation and relaxing music mix. I listened to it every night for weeks and brought it with me to hospital to relax. They even let me bring it into OR. Anyway...happy to answer any questions or help out in anyway. Good luck to you. So so sorry the may list is leafy so long!
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: May 2, 2012 04:56PM longislandmom wrote: Yea floridamomandwife! Welcome to the other side! Goodnluckntomthe rest of u may gals. I'mmday nine post BMX and feeling better every day!
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 04:52AM longislandmom wrote: @floridamomandwife. My PS is a bit of a minimalist and only put in two drains...most put in 4. So I am probably a little more comfortable than most. That said, the drains pinch and ache a bit. Also quite annoying. Soo..not pleasant....But nothing you can't tolerate. I am still putting out a lot of fluid, so I think I'll be stuck with them through next week. Re: camisole...the hospital discharged me with three compression camisole/ bras which I wear 24/7. They have Velcro loops to hold drain bulbs. During the day I wear zip up sweatshirt from target with interior pockets. Love these! Champion makes them and highly recommend. A gal on the march mast list told me about it...great find! Also, I sleep sitting up,in bed. I have a pillow structure we built from a zillion pillows. Two must important ones are the big body pillows. I bought thiose at target, too. Sleeping is definitely the biggest challenge. Some girls get recliners... Otherwise invest in pillows!
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 07:59PM longislandmom wrote: I had my BMX April 23.  the first few weeks were rough.  I slept with pillows propped up for over a month..but  IT GETS BETTER!  PROMISE!  While i still am tight and have some aching and occassional pains -- by in large i feel very good and often forget about my TEs and BMX!  i still don't love sleeping on my side with the TEs..but i can do it! good luck!

Posts.Title: recommendations for a good med oncologist in NYC and NJ areas scaredycatwoman SallyO

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2012 07:38PM LongIslandMama52 wrote: Hi Ladies.... just joining the group.... I started to read from the very beginning but there's just so many so I'm just trying to pick up.  this sounds like a great group.  I found a lump under my left breast on March 28, mammogram on April 10, biopsies on April 12, was told on April 16 I had breast cancer, met with a surgeon on the 17th who said it was Stage 1 and i would have to have a partial mastectomy - scheduled for April 30.  Yesterday surgeon;s  office called to say there was some more information they received from the MRI I had last Friday, and they want to discuss a full mastectomy tomorrow.  This whole time I feel like I've been on a runaway train just hanging on for dear life, but tomorrow I put the breaks on.  If he tells me I should have a full mx I will tell him I want to put the surgery on hold at least until I talk to a plastic surgeon and weigh my options and thoughts about reconstruction.  I'm not completely informed on all of this, so I want to know exactly what I'm doing and what I NEED, not what I'm told to do.  My question is do you think waiting a week or so while I sorted out my options and decided what to do (about reconstruction if necessday) would be a bad thing? Thanks ladies! LI Mama
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: May 26, 2012 10:35AM longislandmom wrote: this is such a fun post! lots of fun names. i was in such shock when i first logged on to this website in the days that i was diagnosed.  who knows what i was thinking!! i live in long island and am a mom-- not much thought beyond that.
Posts.Title: Maybe I'm just nosey... LouiseBogle SuperFoob

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 05:20PM longislandmom wrote: Shayne...I am prone to anxiety and had a hard time after my diagnosis in march. But someone turned me onto a guided mediation by puffy Huddleston....www.healfaster.com and it has npbeen a lifesaver. I listen to it a few times a day. My sleep was restored...no more need for anxiety meds. Also got a mixed tape of massage/ new age music and made it a playlist on my iPod, following the meditation. I brought the iPod into hospital and am still using it every night. Really works!!!! Sometimes I put it on when I wake up at 2am and I go backmtomsleep! Good luck!!
Posts.Title: Help with Anxiety Shayne Shirlann

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2012 10:28PM longislandmom wrote: I am in the raise some hell camp!  NOT OK to make you wait!  I had an abnormal mammogram and was able to beg my way into a biopsy withing 3 days.  got results the next day.  The results weren't good-- but at least i could take control and move forward!  call everyone you know.  find out who knows who.  and beg every scheduling assistant to squeeze you in.  \ but get you appointment!  best of luck!
